meanings.definition: act of serving as a substitute or replacement
meanings.sent1: Her surrogating for her friend at the meeting was greatly appreciated.
meanings.sent2: The surrogating of the missing team member with a temporary replacement helped keep the project on track.
meanings.sent3: The surrogating of the regular teacher with a funny clown brought laughter to the classroom.
meanings.sent4: His surrogating as the superhero in the school play made him feel invincible.
meanings.sent5: The surrogating of the broken toy with a new one made the child smile with joy.

meanings.sent1: She is surrogating for her sister by carrying her baby.
meanings.sent2: The kind woman is surrogating for a couple who cannot have children.
meanings.sent3: The dog surrogating as a mother to the orphaned kittens was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: His passion for surrogating for those in need knows no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The nurse is surrogating the role of a parent for the sick child in the hospital.

meanings.definition: the process of appointing a surrogate
meanings.sent1: The surrogating of a legal guardian was necessary to make decisions for the minor.
meanings.sent2: The surrogating of a representative to act on behalf of the company was a strategic move.
meanings.sent3: The surrogating of a stand-in for the celebrity was a clever marketing tactic.
meanings.sent4: The surrogating of a proxy for the absentee voter ensured their voice was heard.
meanings.sent5: The surrogating of a spokesperson for the organization conveyed a unified message.
